column4: hi, folks. i have an odd (and probably horribly newb) question: is there an easy way to move a panel?  I moved my top panel to the right, and now it blew my icons up HUGE, and I can't right-click on the panel to change it's properties, and I can't drag it up to the top.
how can I get it back to the top?
but why? are the icons too big or something?
when i moved it over, my applications menus and such are up at the top, then it immediately goes to HUGE icons (4 of them), and after that the rest of the bar
can't right click on anything that is the panel itself, i've thuroughly checked the whole bar
the icons are like 90-100 pixels wide
nm, figured it out: had to delete a couple of icons, to get some free (blank) panel space
now i can change it back
will have to re-add those icons, tho
if i submit that as a bug report, do you think anyone would take me seriously?
um...how do i submit a bug report? i mean, gnome is huge, is there a person or list or something i should send gui useability issues to?
I think you could have tweaked something in 'configuration editor' - it has loads of settings for the panel
I remember the first ever gnome beta back on the 2.0 kernels. It stank, the panel expanded to eat your screen several times a day
that's still not intuitive or simple, which is something i think ubuntu works towards
lol. they've come a very long way,t rue
no, it's a bug for definite. you should google for 'gnome usability project', they do exist
